channel.title: My new style!
channel.description:
I took a very long break from GFX because I didn't like what I was "stuck" to making. I always used the same effects and look over and over, and I hated it. I also wanted to change my taste in sigs; the whole cartoony gaming renders were getting on my nerves; I wanted something more mature. So eventually I read up on some tuts, changed my style, and did a few sigs. Here they are, please comment. <3
First of new style: [img]http://img252.imageshack.us/img252/3322/breakingbenjamin5qy.png[/img]
Second (my favorite <3): [img]http://img152.imageshack.us/img152/4753/evilsonic7qh.png[/img]
Third (for a friend; least favorite :(): [img]http://img259.imageshack.us/img259/316/bombermanactzero3gz.png[/img]

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @Immortal Immortal
item.description:
@Immortal wrote:

It’s pathetic to hear things like “a render can only be a cut-out” on this forum. Clearly a small majority of people expect to know everything about Photoshop merely 2 days after getting the software. You are wrong, a render is not just a cut-out of a graphical image, it can be many different things associated with graphics including, but not only:
A) A graphical 2D or 3D form that represents shape, tone, colour, texture etc. EG a C4D
B) A cut-out of a person or figure of interest.
C) Removing the background from a solid peice of graphics and making a cut-out of the main part EG the person in the middle.
D) God, there’s so many explanations of what a render is, just don’t claim you think what it is if you make up some lame explanation.

Also, a ‘render’ with a background still attatched is called a stock image or photograph. When you see a game wallpaper it is a stock image, when you cut out the main char EG Master Chief, it is referred to as a ‘render’ of sorts.

Back on topic:
nice sigs, the second one is probably the most interesting one in the collection. The only problem is the second is slightly too contrasted. Try using Levels or Brightness/Contrast to brighten it up a little and to help define the focal point of your sig. Overall, nice style, keep working hard and it is good to hear that you are pursuing a new style

Read full topic

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

All right, I understand. I’m just saying that when you post something like that, either make it explicit in the post you have it in, or include the original, to prevent misunderstandings like this.

Read full topic

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:12, topic:51365”]Yea next time, post the original also. And aside from the lens flare, I really cant tell a difference.
[/quote]

I never said I created it. I even told people it was a Breaking Benjamin sig; if I truly wanted to keep it hush-hush, I wouldn’t have said that. And I’m not going to post every single resource I use. If someone would have asked what I used, I would’ve gladly linked them. And I already explained what I did. The other “main” effect besides the flare and lighting was the overlay; contrasted the wings from the background and gave 'em the burned look, as I said before.

Read full topic

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Yea next time, post the original also. And aside from the lens flare, I really cant tell a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

xxlegitxx:

Wtf did you do with the first one? You just took the album cover of Phobia, then added a sig?

Took the cover, made another layer, set it to overlay to give the wings a kindof “burned” effect. Put in a lens flare. Changed the lighting settings to bring out the flare’s light effect. Made a plain black and white gradient layer, took of the border of it, put it over all of the layers and set it to overlay, and added text. Might’ve done some smudging, but I honestly don’t remember.

Read full topic

item.title: My new style!
item.dc:creator: @Sepranem Sepranem
item.description:
@Sepranem wrote:

1337h4x:

Those are good, but I like youre current sig more.

Damn, all 3 of my sigs just got owned by one sentence. :rolleyes:

[quote=“God of Ikiliki, post:3, topic:51365”]Looks nice
8/10 for first and second
7.5 for last because the background is a little bit empty…
If thats normal I give it 8/10 to lol[/quote]

Thanks. Any suggestions you can think of to make them better? Personally I think the Sonic one expresses what I wanted it to near-perfectly, so I don’t think I need to fix up that one. The Breaking Benjamin one seemed fine to me, not as good at expressing as the Sonic one, but not bad either. As for the last one, this is where I was at a loss for ideas. I tried playing around with effects and it seemed like everything I added made it seem to busy, and leaving it like that seems too calm. = \

Read full topic
